data.meta_description: Academy Award   1965   - Debbie Reynolds - Best Actress Nomination for: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
data.text:
Debbie Reynolds Awards & Filmography

Awards

Academy Award

1965 - Best Actress Nomination for:

The Unsinkable Molly Brown

2015 - Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award

Actors Fund Award

1974 - Outstanding Performance in:"Irene"

American Comedy Award

1997 Lifetime Achievement

Antoinette Perry Award (The Tony Award)

1974 Best Performance by an Actress Nomination for: "Irene"

Blockbuster Entertainment Award

1998 Favorite Supporting Actress Nomination - Comedy, for: In & Out

Casino Legends Hall Of Fame

2004 Debbie Reynolds was inducted into the Casino Legends Hall Of Fame on October 31, 2004 in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Chapman University, Orange, California

2006 Lifetime Achievement in the Arts Award

Costume Designers Presidents Award

2004 Debbie Reynolds received the Costume Designers Presidents Award

The Ceremony celebragte both her career and her part in the preservation of Hollywood Costumes.

Cue Magazine

1974 Entertainer of the Year Award for: "Irene"

Crystal Star Award

2001 Presented by the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising for Debbie's efforts in preserving film history

Daytime Emmy Award

2000 Outstanding Performer Nomination for: Gift of Love: The Daniel Huffman Story

Emmy Award

2000 Outstanding Best Actress in a Comedy Series Nomination for: "Will & Grace"

Golden Apple Award

1954 Most Cooperative Actress

Golden Globe

1951 New Star of the Year Nomination for: Three Little Words

1957 Best Motion Picture Actress, Musical/Comedy Nomination for: Bundle of Joy

1965 Best Motion Picture Actress, Musical/Comedy Nomination for: The Unsinkable Molly Brown

1970 Best TV Actress, Musical/Comedy Nomination for: "The Debbie Reynolds Show"

1997 Best Motion Picture Actress, Musical/Comedy Nomination for: Mother

Golden Satellite Award

1996 Best Actress in a Supporting Role for: Mother

Grauman's Chinese Theater Award

1965 Hand & Footprint Block

Hasty Pudding Theatricals

1955 Woman of the Year

Hollywood Chambers Lifetime Achievement Award

2003 Debbie Reynolds received the Hollywood Chambers Lifetime Achievement Award.Debbie is the first woman to receive this award.

Hollywood Walk of Fame

1997 Star on the Walk of Fame

Debbie Reynolds has THREE STARS on the Walk Of Fame!

Las Vegas Comedy Festival Lifetime Achievement Award

2002 Lifetime Achievement Award

Laurel Award

1958 Top Female Comedy Performance, runner-up for: Tammy and the Bachelor

1962 Top Female Comedy Performance, nomination for: The Second Time Around

1963 Top Female Comedy Performance, nomination for: My Six Loves

1965 Best Musical Performance, runner-up for: The Unsinkable Molly Brown

1966 Best Musical Performance, runner-up for: The Singing Nun

1968 Best Female Comedy Performance, third-place for: Divorce American Style

Liberace Legend Award

1994 "For Contributions to the Community and the World of Entertainment"

Lone Star Film & Television Award

1998 Special Award - "Texas Legend"

Mary Pickford Award of Achievement

2003 Debbie Reynolds was presented with the Mary Pickford Award of Achievement, in Los Angeles,CA.

Modern Screen Award

1956 Most Popular

Screen Actors Guild

2014 Life Achievement Award

Shenandoah Apple Blossom Festival, Winchester, Virginia

2011 Grand Marshal

Star National Board of Review

1956 NBR Award, Best Supporting Actress for: The Catered Affair

Nevada Theater Ballet

2001 Woman of the Year Award

Outer Critics Circle Award

1974 Outstanding Performance in: "Irene"

Palm Springs International Film Festival

1999 Lifetime Achievement Award

Photoplay Award

1952 Most Popular Female Star

1958 Most Popular Female Star

1968 Most Popular Female Star

Reno, University of Nevada

2007 Doctor of Humane Letters for contributions to the film studies program for many years
